results.title: Male and female in plants and animals
results.brief_description: Introduces the concept of male and female in plants and animals. Animation is used to show the locations of reproductive organs in different kind plants and animals: algae, flowering plants, insects, fish, amphibians, birds, and mammals, including humans. Through microphotography, various kinds of sperm cells and egg cells are closely examined. A human sperm is observed entering an egg cell.

results.title: Male and female
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Let’s Talk about It”.
Part one of a three part series which follows through the educational experiences of an upper primary school class as they learn about human reproduction and sexuality. In this part the children explore their concepts of ‘maleness’ and ‘femaleness’ with their teachers, learning about anatomical differences, the process of fertilisation and conception. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Malcolm X
results.creator_credit: Largo Entertainment, 40 Acres and a Mule Filmworks, Marvin Worth and Spike Lee
results.brief_description: Malcolm X was one of the most controversial American political figures. Based on Alex Haley’s “The Autobiography of Malcolm X”. It is a landmark film in that it has an African-American as the hero of a Hollywood epic. Malcolm X was initially a small-time crim who converted to Islam and became a central figure in the the Civil Rights Movement in the 1960s. A passionate and dynamic speaker, his vehement condemnation of race relations fightened and incensed many white Americans. The film faithfully follows Malcolm X’s life: his poor childhood and violent early adulthood, his prison years, his involvement in the Nation of Islam and the Civil Rights Movement, and the lead-up to his assassination. Though a long film of the epic genre, Spike Lee’s direction is colourful and well-paced, and some of the sequences are dazzling, including the pilgrimmage to Mecca. Spike Lee was the first Western filmmaker allowed to film in the Holy City. “Malcolm X” reclaims, with passion and dignity, the life of a controversial but inspiring man. Denzel Washington plays Malcolm X and Angela Bassett plays his wife. Cast alson includes Al Freeman Jr, Albert Hall, Delroy Lindo.

constellations_other.name: MLK/FBI: blackness In America
constellations_other.description: Award-winning documentarian Sam Pollard looks at J. Edgar Hoover and the FBI’s pursuit of Martin Luther King Jr in the lead-up to his assassination during America’s Civil Rights Movement of the sixties.

results.title: Malcolm McKinnon: 6 films for MAP at ACMI
results.brief_description: A collection of six short documentary films from an ongoing project between the filmmaker, Malcolm McKinnon, and small museums in the Wimmera farming region of Victoria. They comprise of local stories told by local people from such areas as Warracknabeal, Rainbow, Murtoa, Brim and Coromby.

results.title: Malcolm
results.brief_description: Malcolm, a simple genius played by Colin Friels, loses his job at a Melbourne tram depot after building his own one-man tram and taking to the streets. With funds dwindling, Malcolm is forced to take in a lodger, a small time criminal who moves in with girlfriend, Judith. Frank soon realises that Malcolm’s mechanical wizardry can help his career - the result - a series of oddball but unsuccessful robberies that culminates in the heist of the decade that stretches Malcolm’s devices to the full. “Malcolm” was critically acclaimed worldwide and received eight AFI Awards including best director and best film.

constellations_other.name: Processing grief through art
constellations_other.description: Thor: Love and Thunder begins with Thor meditating in a robe designed by Gumbaynggirr/Bundjalung artist Otis Hope Carey, best known for Ngalunggirr miinggi (healing spirit) (2020), a painting that expresses his grief over the loss of grandmother. Many artists process grief through their creative work.

results.title: Malbangka country (A)
results.creator_credit: Australian Institute of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Studies and Curtis Levy
results.brief_description: Gustav Malbangka and his family have set up their own community at Gilbert Springs, in the heart of Malbangka country. Gustav talks about his early life, his reasons for leaving Hermannsburg (a Lutheran Mission in Central Australia) and his plans for the future. Shows daily life at Gilbert Springs and a trip to Areyonga. Photography by Geoff Burton. Narrated by Gus Williams.

results.title: Malaysia: sparrow with sparrow, raven with raven
results.creator_credit: John Temple, Arch Nicholson and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Asian insight”.
A look at the historical and cultural background of Malaysia. Religion and politics play an important part in the life style of the people. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Malaysia: land of contrasts
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Travellers’ guide to the Orient”.
A two part tour of Malaysia. Part 1: Kuala Lumpur, Cameron Highlands, Kuantan & Terengganu. A survey of the temples, shopping centres and gardens of the Malaysian capital, Kuala Lumpur; the jungle walks and hill stations of the Cameron Highlands, and the beautiful beaches of Pahang, Kuantan and Terengganu. Part 2: Penang, Ipoh, Genting Highlands, Negeri Sembilan & Melaka. The tour continues through the cities of Penang, Ipoh and Melaka and the palaces and castles of Negeri Sembilan and the Genting Highlands.

results.title: Malaysia
results.creator_credit: Maria Nicolo, Tom Hurwitz, Nihon Hoso Kyokai, Maryland Public Television and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mini dragons. II”.
Since the British withdrew from Malaysia in the 50’s Malaysia has developed dramatically in an economic sense. Now the government has a thirty year plan, Vision 2020, which seeks to accelerate this development in favour of the native Malays rather than the successful Chinese. The program looks at individuals and their particular problems: a Chinese business man, who is attempting to set up a multi-racial business school, a rubber and oil palm plantation manager who faces the loss of his workforce to the cities, a tribal community who face government takeover of their land, and a young Moslem woman who is attempting to protect from exploitation the young girls recruited from villages to work in the city factories.

results.title: Malayan University
results.creator_credit: Malayan Film Unit and Osman Shamsudin
results.brief_description: The University of Malaya is young, but its growing reputation has already fully justified its foundation, in 1949, with full university status. It has faculties of Arts, Science and Medicine. The film shows the work being done in these and the wide range of cultural activities available to its students as well as their formal studies.
